_header: God Father in heaven of mights most
_description: A paraphrase of Old Testament history, including Judith and the Maccabees — 18,372 lines in 12-line stanzas

BodSelSup52.First Lines:
God fader in heuyn of myghtes mostThat mad this mold & all man
                    kynd…
BodSelSup52.Last Lines:
…þat we may be worthyto wun with þem in
                    heuyn
BodSelSup52.Editions:
Heuser,  Wilhelm. 
             “Die altestamentlichen dichtungen des ms. Seld. Supra 52 der Bodleiana:
                Ein vergessenes werk und ein übersehenes manuskript.” 
             Anglia
         31 (1908): 1-24: 4-24 (extracts).
Kalen,  Herbert,  and  Urban Ohlander.  
             A Middle English Metrical Paraphrase of the Old Testament.
             5 vols. 
             Göteborgs Högskolas Arsskrift 28; Gothenberg Studies in
                English
         5, 11, 16, 24. Stockholm: Almqvist & Wiskell; Göteborg:
            Elanders, 1923-72: 1.5 (vv. 1-6000); 5: vv. 6001-6924; 11: vv.
                        6925-end.
Peck,  Russell A.,
                        ed.  
             Heroic Women from the Old Testament in Middle English Verse.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 1991: (The Story of Jephthah and his Daughter and The Story of
                        Judith).

Longleat257.First Lines:
…Thre monethis theym hym hyd and longere they durst noght
                    abydeBot in a case hym did and layd hym by the see syde…
Longleat257.Last Lines:
…Pray we to god forthy with the modre and hire sonnes
                    sevenThat we may be worthy to wonne with them in heven
Longleat257.Note:
Begins imperfectly in the Book of Exodus: Exodus (fols.
                        119-121v), Numbers (ff. 122-125), Deuteronomy (ff.
                        125-125v), Joshua (ff. 125v-128), Judges (ff.
                    128-135), Ruth (ff. 135-136), Kings (ff. 136-187v), Job (ff.
                    189-195), Tobit (ff. 195-201v), Hester (ff.
                        201v-204v), Judith (ff.
                        204v-208v), ‘De matre cu[m] viite[m].
                        pu[er]is.’ (from II Maccabees: ff. 209-212).
Longleat257.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             “Nachträge zu den Legenden 5: The Messengers of Death.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         79 (1887): 411-70: 447-54 (story of the Maccabees).
